Description:
Manage the day-to-day operations of the Finance Department by providing expertise, encouraging teamwork, and aligning work processes in order to achieve high-performance standards, achieve established targets and objectives, and ensure employee engagement in a motivated work environment.
Manage the development of a sound financial plan for the purpose of managing financial and physical capital.
Oversee the updated financial planning and reporting functions, sales budgets, and other financial information in the ERP system.
Review budgeted sales, validate edited budgets, and ensure that new budgets are continuously updated on the ERP system.
Provide accurate, comprehensive, and timely information regarding the financial status through practical accounting concepts, principles, procedures, and systems.
Oversee the finance and accounting functions in line with leading practices.
Oversee verification of contract documentation to ensure clarity of payment terms and other financial terms in line with business objectives.
Ensure that bank reconciliations are done accurately and timely in coordination with the Accounts Supervisors.
Manage payment-related activities: purchasing, staff payroll, and salary-related issues, manage local and foreign accounts and supervise the daily activities of the Bill collectors.
Advise top management on the financial implications of new projects in order to protect the corporate interests and minimize financial liabilities and adopt a robust due diligence exercise to ensure that all financial provisions are adhered to.
Liaise with external auditors to ensure all relevant financial information has been provided.
Provide input and recommend the continuous improvement of financial practices considering ‘international best practice’, changes in international standards, and changes in the business environment which demand proactive action plans.
Perform ad-hoc and other duties related to the job as assigned by management.Skills
Skills:
Minimum of 5-7 years of experience preferably in Retail.
Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or a related field.
A Master’s degree in Finance or Accounting would be an advantage.
Certified Management Accountant (CMA) certification, Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), is preferred.
